meanings.definition: Capable of being shocked or surprised.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected plot twist in the movie was truly shockable.
meanings.sent2: She had a shockable reaction when she saw the surprise party.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's reaction to the vacuum cleaner was quite shockable.
meanings.sent4: The magician's disappearing act was so shockable that the audience gasped.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm was a shockable event for the young child.

meanings.definition: Able to receive an electric shock.
meanings.sent1: Make sure the device is not shockable before touching it.
meanings.sent2: The rubber gloves are designed to protect against shockable situations.
meanings.sent3: The robot's circuits were not shockable, so it safely handled electricity.
meanings.sent4: The metal conductor was shockable, causing a sudden jolt.
meanings.sent5: The warning sign indicated the area was shockable, so caution was necessary.
